text:
web::response -select default should set the default output channel
  depending on mode (websh or mod_websh), web::response -select default
  should set the channel to the default channel (currently stdout and 
  apache respectively)
creator: davidw@apache.org
davidw@apache.org
text:
I'm not sure how this is different from:

web::response -reset ?

creator: ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text:
[web::response -select <channel>] selects <channel> as the default
output for any web::put* commands.
The default channel is "stdout" in the stand-alone case and "apache"
in the mod_websh case.
To be able to reset to the default channel, the developer must now
know in wich mode websh is used. The command [web::response -select
default] would reset the channel to its default automatically
("stdout" or "apache").

creator: davidw@apache.org
text:
Added web::response -select option "default", plus test case.  Works in both
mod_websh and as a CGI.
